name: Radisson Martinique on Broadway

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was a little apprehensive, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The location is hard to beat - right at Herald Square. The front desk staff, although a little slow at check-in, and the bell staff we very helpful. The rooms were clean and a decent size for New York standards.
reviews.title: Overall a good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elevators are very slow, and one of the three was out of order for the entire weekend, but that was our only real inconvenience, which wasn't much of one at all.
reviews.title: Fine Experience...

likes.disliked: — The smell in the check-in area

reviews.text: We arrived very late - around midnight - and had booked two rooms. Much to my surprise, we were still assigned rooms right next to each other.
reviews.title: Hated the Hotel - Loved the Doorman!

reviews.text: I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We stayed at The Radisson Martinique on a last minute journey into the city for one night.
reviews.title: you can do better

reviews.text: We weren't sure what to make of the Martinique as quite a few of the reviews painted a picture of chaos, but our travel agent has never let us down, so we arrived on the 27th December. We turned up just before 4pm & booked in straight away & went to our room on the sixth floor. I had asked for a quiet room because of other reviews, the room was fine & a reasonable size but had no view. This was our first visit to New York so we weren't too bothered as long as the room was clean. First impressions were not that good, the lobby was small & very busy with a lot of flight crew. The bar & restaurant was all very open & could do to be sectioned off to give a more intimate feel. We had a meal that night in the hotel & were happy with the service & quality. The following morning we had breakfast at the 1st floor restaurant. $15 for the buffet was more than we needed but the service & food we had was ok. We did see one of the waiters completely ignore a guest & refuse to even discuss there request. There did seem to be a bit of tension so I can't comment on what lead up to this but no one forced these people to become waiters or work in the service industry & to ignore the very people who contribute to there wages by staying in the hotel is completely unacceptable. We decided that we would eat out after this. On consecutive days we had to chase housekeeping as our room hadn't been cleaned by late afternoon, this was after informing them earlier in the day. On one occasion we talked to housekeeping twice & then contacting the reception desk. The mini bar, which we found to be fine & offered $15 credit if you spent $15, was never restocked the whole of our stay. Check your bill on departure as the $15 credit wasn't included in our bill but was deducted when pointed out, I put it down to an oversight. We found the concierge to be very helpful & used them to book tickets to the Empire State & Statue of Liberty (take the advice, get there early to beat the queues). The best thing about the hotel is its location, come out of the hotel & turn right onto Broadway & Macys, turn left & walk to 5th Avenue. The Empire State is only a block & a half up 5th & next door is the Heartland Pub & Restaurant. This place was great for food & service, we ate here quite a lot. Times Square is a 10min walk up Broadway as is Bryant Park. We walked up Broadway to Central Park & down 5th, quite a walk but a great way to see the city, we did this several days stopping for lunch & visiting stores. The restaurant in Macys is worth a visit any time but especially for breakfast as is Andrews Coffee Shop & the Brooklyn Diner. We had lunch at the Stage Deli, it was ok but could do with a make over & is maybe living on its reputation. If you go to Macys make sure to pick up an International Savings Card for 11% discount. This review may not sound very good about the hotel but to be honest it's not as bad as some of the other reviews & most of the staff were very friendly & helpful. The location is excellent & we felt very safe especially at night when security check everyone coming into the hotel. When we go back to NYC we will probably try another hotel but would be happy to stay here again. If you go for New Year as a couple or group of friends then try to stay right in Times Square, after 6pm you can't get near. Taxis from JFK are $45 + tolls ($49), we flew back from Newark & that was $65 arranged by the Doorman.
reviews.title: New Year

reviews.text: Ok, so we knew we'd have to pay an arm and a leg to stay anywhere in Manhatten during New Year's Eve, but we expected at least a clean environment. Due to severe asthma, I made a point on contacting the hotel prior to the stay and requesting a non-smoking room. Well, the room was techincally a non-smoking room, but due to the ventilation in the building and the lack of constant circulation to filter the air, our non-smoking room became a nasty smoking room in the late evenings. When we called downstairs for help with the situation, they offered air freshener! Finally, we did get a maintenance man to unbolt the window and tuen on the heat. When we told the manager about this, he was very accusatory and doubting of our experience. For over $500 a night, I'd expect a bit more! The food was awful in the restaurant as was the service. In fact, most of the staff was rude except for the front doormen who were very helpful and friendly. Stay away from this lemon....great location, but you'd be better off a bit farter away and with something that didn't smell like a 20 year old ashtray.
reviews.title: This place is AWFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over New Years 2006. Will not return.
reviews.title: Great Location, awful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro:
reviews.title: Above average. Especially for a Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Just off of time square
reviews.title: Average hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 4 days in the Radisson Martinique. Our only problem was checking in - we arrived on time to find we had to wait three hours for our room. After travelling from Belfast we were exhausted and disappointed. The attitude of the staff ranged from rude to very helpful. To be fair we did get a few drinks vouchers for the hotel bar and after complaining again two hours later we got a complimentary breakfast. To be honest I would rather of had my room to rest and freshen up in than anything else. The next day we realised that the hotel has contractual arrangements with at least one airline - they use rooms for as long as they need them - unlike Joe Public who is out at 11. Another thing, the so called free internet sucks!
reviews.title: Airline Cabin crew come first

reviews.text: Apart from that the rooms are clean and well looked after and the hotel location is excellent. Good luck checking in - you will need it!!
reviews.title: Solid, not spectacular, handy to the south end of midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Radisson Martinique twice for business. The price can be decent for the area if you catch it right and dig around a little. The hotel is undergoing some renovation, but none seemed to be in prominent areas.
reviews.title: Great Stopover

reviews.text: I've had a regular single and was once given one of their jr. exec singles. Obviously the latter was much nicer, larger, better bathroom. The regular single is typical for NYC - very small room. I found the rooms to be clean, serviceable, and the bathrooms to be reasonably up-to-date.
reviews.title: Full Review of Radisson Martinique on Broadway
We Lucked Out
reviews.text: The location is solid, if you don't mind being around the corner from the Empire State. It makes that and lower midtown (MSG) highly accessible. Subway stop is literally steps from the front door.

Like most things I guess it's all down to money. I was really lucky, I had originally booked this hotel when it was a Holiday Inn at the Wexas rate of 170 dollars and Radisson were good enough to honour this even though the cheapest rate had gone up to 360 dollars. It was close to Thanksgiving!
reviews.title: Great at the right price

likes.disliked: — A rather ordinary place with not much to recommend it

reviews.text: For 170 it is great value but not for the man in the lift I heard saying to his colleague, 'I'm not staying in this crappy hotel again for 400 a night'.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: It is a clean hotel and the rooms are a pretty good size. The buffet breakfast is basic but good value. There is a reasonable coffee shop and small bar. However the two things that stand out are its excellent location (it's minutes from Macys and the Empire State Building) and the friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Average Hotel Would Not Stay Here Again

likes.disliked: — Security that made you feel like you were in prison

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I'd stay again if I could get a rate of 250 dollars or so a night.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Radisson Martinique

reviews.text: We were having a reunion of sorts in NYC, there were four of us from Canada, who hadn't seen each other in years. We booked the Radison through Priceline, so it came at a decent price. The room was small, but just fine- 2 double beds, and a rather small bathroom for 4 women. There were lots of towells. The hotel was very quiet, and in such a great location for exploring the city. The hotel staff, like everyone we met in NYC, were helpful, friendly, and very accomodating. We checked out and left our luggage on our last day, and the bell captain was extremely helpful in helping us figure out how to get to JFK. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but discovered Speedy's across from the hotels, which had great breakfasts. Would stay there again, as long as the price was right.
reviews.title: A slew of minor frustrations

reviews.text: Great location close to the Empire State building and also the Metro system.
reviews.title: New York , New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to get around from the hotel all the tourist areas eaily accessed from the area and Macys a 2 min walk for all that important shopping
reviews.title: As the real estae agents would say Location Location Location

reviews.text: Hotel clean and tidy rooms like most New York hotels of an adequte size ideal for the sight seeing but quite noisey due to its central location
reviews.title: fantastic location, ideal for shoppers...
Valentines weekend break
reviews.text: Recepti,on staff did their job but didnt put themselves out when we arrived e.g. when we booked in staff provided us with keys and no friendly greeting or directions as to where to find lifts etc very unusual for the US where service with a smile is the norm .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps the management need to do some customer service training as the front desk is your first experience of this hotel.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: The Martinique on Broadway is a well located midtown hotel, one block away from the Empire State and Macys. It is within walking distance of Times Square.
reviews.title: An Ok Hotel, but ...

reviews.text: We tried to check in at 2.00pm, but were told the room was not ready and to come back at 4.00pm. When we returned the receptionist still had a struggle to find us a room. Overall the reception desk was not a welcoming experience.
reviews.title: Excellent NYC hotel!!!!

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable, quiet, secure, excellent location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was a triple. It was small, containing two narrow double beds. Decor was a little tired and the bathroom had seen better days. The good news was that it was at the rear of the hotel away from the traffic noise.
reviews.title: Okay stay

likes.disliked: — consistent problems with assigning smoking rooms

reviews.text: Avoid the mini-bar - $3.25 for a can of soda! There is a Duane Reade drugstore virtually next door charging the proper prices.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel in Herald Square

likes.liked: — Great Beds - Clean, well appointed room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was adequate, but expensive. Better to find a diner for better value.
reviews.title: Decent midtown price/value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend went to this hotel which is perfect for the location, When we arrived our room was not ready, however to apologise the hotel gave us several vouchers for free drinks at the bar. On our last day we asked someone at reception to phone the taxi company and confirm it to pick us up at 10 am and was told to do it ourselves. I would not speak to someone like that and do not expect to be treated like that as a customer. There are plenty of hotels around new york and I will be trying one of them next time. When in New York go to Bubba Gumps restaurant on broadway. Best place in the world.
reviews.title: Hotel amazing but customer service was extremely poor!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: A little pricey, but worth it. Spacious rooms, close to restaurants and shopping.

I stayed 2 times a week-end ( 5 - 7 feb and a week-end during January) in this hotel. I think the location is the only thing that you have to book in this hotel. I had two different room, the first one was really small with a small bed and the second one was bigger with king size but for both the rooms looked really old and not cozy. The bathroom is really small and old.
reviews.title: better location than the hotel

reviews.text: There is a business center with free access
reviews.title: A perfect stay!

reviews.text: I´ve been in many wonderful hotels around the world, as I´ve already been in 17 different countries. But Radisson Martinique on Broadway was a surprising hotel, much better than I could imagine. Considering Manhattan rates, it´s a cheap hotel. I paid 800 US for 10 days. The location is perfect, walking distance to many important atractions of NY, and just above of a subway station. All services were well done and the concierge was very helpfull and friendly. The room is clean, silent (my room was on 16th floor), and beds are very comfortable. My stay was perfect and I recommend this hotel for everyone who wants to enjoy NYC without problems.
reviews.title: the worst hotel EVER
nice hotel
reviews.text: nice and the friendly staff.....comfortable and air conditioned rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had been recommended to us as an excellent location in the heart of Manhattan. In that regard, we weren't disappointed. A subway entrance is right as you walk out the building or, if you want shopping, Macy's is just a few blocks away. You really can't beat the location, but that's if you're willing to suffer through the freezing rooms and the staff's attitudes. As soon as we walked into our 8th floor room (with an excellent view of a brick wall), we went to turn up the thermostat. Alas, it was stuck on 60 degrees, regardless of our attempts to turn it up. We called down to the main desk and after forty-five minutes a repairman arrived. He poked and prodded around, messing with the main unit for a couple minutes (we later realized all he did was press the "on/off" button of the main unit), and then declared it would get warm in no time. Twenty minutes later: still freezing! We replicated his actions to no avail. Needless to say, we tried to stay out of the room as much as possible, despite the outside temperature holding steady at 20 degrees. The room was clean, though the lights gave off an odd, bright white light, which is fine if you're working in a high-tech laboratory, but not if you want to read a book in bed. The TV - a flat screen Sharp - had a number problems, including freezing up, making squeeling sounds, and not responding to the remote. The internet was similar. The hotel website boasts high-speed wireless internet, free!, in every room. In reality, every room is equipped with the lowest broadband wireless access, but with the option to purchase high speed for $12.95 per day. Geez! Was the room worth the price? Heck no! Upon checkout, there were two staff members behind the desk, and one was helping another couple. The other staff member was bustling around, but clearly doing nothing. The man before me kept trying to grab her attention to ask her if a box of his had arrived. She said, "you expectin' a box?" before ignoring him and moving on to other tasks. His repeated efforts to get her attention were fruitless. Five minutes later, she asks me if I want to check out, completely ignoring the guy who had been desperately trying to talk to her for ten minutes. I motioned to him and said, "he was here before me," and finally she listened to his question and helped. The service was poor, the staff rude and inefficient. The only redeeming thing about the hotel was the bellman and his staff. They were pleasant, quick, and courteous. On the whole, I wouldn't stay there again, regardless of the location.
reviews.title: Great Location, But Don't Count On Service!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights. It was an all girls shopping trip.This hotel was exactly what we wanted location wise.We wanted somewhere central for shopping.The location of this hotel was excellent minutes walk from Macys and 5th Avenue.Staff were really nice and helpful.We ate in the restaurant one night and it was really nice.We went across the road to Speedys(restaurant across the road) most mornings for breakfast. They did a great buffet breakfast.The hotel itself and the rooms were very clean.My only complaint would be the size of the room. I found the room very small and storage area for luggage etc was minimal.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel was also great for sight seeing most of the sights were walking distance from the hotel.ie Empire State Building,Central Park,Time Square,Madison Square Gardens etc..There is also a subway station straight outside the door of the hotel .
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 nights at the Radisson and we were well impressed. Courteous and helpful staff and spacious clean double bedded room.
reviews.title: Great location, good restaurant, clean rooms.

aka: Radisson Martinique On Broadway Hotel New York City
description: Modern Hotel with French Renaissance exterior & traditional interior, housed in building dating from 1897.
